message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
public void doGet(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response) throws ServletException, IOException {
    try {
        FileWriter writer = new FileWriter("OrderFormData.csv");
        writer.append("FieldName");
        writer.append(',');
        writer.append("Value");
        writer.append('\n');
        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
        Enumeration<String> paramNames = request.getParameterNames();
        while (paramNames.hasMoreElements()) {
            String paramName = (String) paramNames.nextElement();
            writer.append(paramName);
            writer.append(',');
            String[] paramValues = request.getParameterValues(paramName);
            if (paramValues == null) {
                writer.append("unchecked");
                writer.append('\n');
            } else {
                for (int i = 0; i < paramValues.length; i++) {
                    writer.append(paramValues[i]);
                    writer.append(',');
                }
                writer.append('\n');
            }
        }
        writer.flush();
        writer.close();
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that unchecked checkboxes do not send their values when a form is submitted. Therefore, when you call request.getParameterValues(paramName), it returns null for unchecked checkboxes. To handle this, you can check if paramValues is null. If it is, you can write "unchecked" to the file. If it's not null, you can write the values as you were doing before.
